definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing

sentences.english: Or it can strengthen the group paid to dig it.
sentences.chinese: 或者它可以加強花錢打井的集體的勢力。

sentences.english: Sticking pipe has been being a complicated problem in drilling this area.
sentences.chinese: 在這個地區打井，卡鑽一直是個複雜問題。

sentences.english: To drill in this area will be a wonderful experience.
sentences.chinese: 在這個地區打井將是一個絕妙的經歷。

sentences.english: China will continue to carry out well-drilling and water supply projects in Africa to provide safe drinking water for the African people.
sentences.chinese: 繼續援助打井供水項目，爲民衆提供安全飲用水。

sentences.english: As soon as everything was ready, they started spudding in.
sentences.chinese: 當一切就緒後，他們立刻著手打井。

sentences.english: A generator for electricity. A well for water.
sentences.chinese: 沒有電話線，用發電機發電，打井來供應水源。

sentences.english: All these years we have been drilling in this area.
sentences.chinese: 這幾年我們一直在這個地區打井。

sentences.english: I shall never forget the days we drilled wells together.
sentences.chinese: 我決不忘記我們在一起打井的日子。

sentences.english: The process of punching a well hasn't changed in a century.
sentences.chinese: 打井的過程已經持續了一個世紀而沒有變化。

definition: to pilot a ship/to channel water/to draw water (for irrigation)
water intake/to obtain water (from a well etc)
to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
to prospect/to dig for coal or minerals
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
